title: Grades 11-12
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

0250B8E2DE5F4623BD0DB9042B1932B3.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

E7D428C73788446580247DB7200732DD.description:
Interpret simple figures of speech encountered
while reading or listening.

34304983E1744E8D93F5E238A59CF650.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

6353523FFA0744DD9494C3C390B9D3F0.description:
Consult reference materials (dictionaries, online
vocabulary supports) to clarify the meaning of
unfamiliar words encountered when reading.

6EE89A46B87A4FCF80AEBA106DF7FA37.description:
Identify and use root words and the words that
result when affixes are added or removed.Â

F67ED239A66C440589C6F241FE1FBAC1.description:
Use context to determine the meaning of unknown
words.

36A3B5AA43A84F7A93E514CAEE24DD30.description:
Vary sentence structure using a variety of
simple and compound sentence structures

CA736F9FD9E34D4CAB1A16C146BA069C.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

4969260988E64ABDB98F28CABD886538.description:
Spell most single-syllable words correctly and
apply knowledge of word chunks in spelling longer
words.

257878803B9E40FAAB40AD2279F7C63B.description:
Demonstrate conventions of standard English
including capitalization, ending punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

49B4BDB2AD4A4CCD8741E928D3C98C47.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

9E9B1662F2B44FE38FB59BCCEE2BCCD0.description:
Use digital, electronic, and other resources and
tools to improve uses of language as needed.

205F1DDE87B344FCA5372DF0550FB7DF.description: Use conventions of standard English when needed.Â

F0DC0459D6C549798EFFA619717F87F7.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

E1C189368CA1459DBCF6F8BA18C1730A.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of
contexts and tasks using complete sentences when
indicated or appropriate.

312841CE0EB943AAA0DE7846926852A0.description:
Use digital media strategically (e.g., textual,
graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in
presentations to support understanding and add interest.

9AEDA9F3B1DF488F887DFF74E338E59B.description:
Present an argument on a topic using an
organization appropriate to the purpose, audience, and
task.

CB37434D306043099ED172BE7028F672.description:
Determine whether the claims and
reasoning enhance the speakerâs argument on a topic.

F4DEEBE350C5438D865DC12C440A79C1.description:
Determine the credibility and accuracy of
information presented across diverse media or formats.Â

1859AEAD78EF4DEF934731583DC36712.description:
Respond to agreements and disagreements in a
discussion.

E168A9613E544F768FC2204648A70AFF.description:
Ask and answer questions to verify or clarify own
ideas and understandings during a discussion.Â

E43B4E12D52945128D019E3B9D3A0DE2.description:
Work with peers to set rules and goals for
discussions.Â

21EBC81321FF4770875AC8D375E95D7B.description:
Prepare for discussions by collecting information
on the topic.Â

BFEEED28AAFD43C88905AD88BE6BCF0D.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames
(time for research, reflection, and revision) for a range of
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4460AD985A2543CC8AE6C72AD6084ACC.description:
Apply Grades 11-12 Essential Elements for
Reading Standards to informational texts (eg,
âCompare and contrast reasoning and arguments
used in one's work with those used in seminal U.S.
texts.â).Â

AEB90BD7788643BB8FC4EAD85D0CBC12.description:
Apply Grades 11-12 Essential Elements for
Reading Standards to literature (e.g., âCompare
and contrast elements of American literature to
other literary works, self, or oneâs world. [Compare
themes, topics, locations, context, and point of
view].â).

8556A0ABF08D422EA2EB9360F0360E40.description:
Cite evidence from literary or informational
texts.

EC5A34D7F73A4B0BB0FEF2331F4C2559.description:
Write answers to research questions by
selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

0C3224C803D14FE6A184CDF5777A4326.description:
Conduct research projects to answer
questions posed by self and others using multiple sources
of information.

F3E8B2BE3BC147F69235BCEE5908E8A3.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BD52FC41851D44D7BAAC7AB33995A067.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce publish and update an individual or shared writing
project.

B5DA719C87CB4F49A2A5DC3BD564E4A6.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed
by planning, revising, editing, and rewriting.

1881E8F1509A46A7A16759668E83DC9E.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate to a
particular task, purpose, and audience.Â

9DD87BA75C0C48E6A11A226AFBF3B294.description:
Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a
vivid picture of experiences, events, setting, or
characters.

F5B10C9AD5554908B04639262C4BFA1D.description:
Organize the events in the narrative using temporal
words to signal order and add cohesion.

F32D4FDDE02A428DBD5424BB9A700082.description:
Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or
observation including at least one character,
details, and clearly sequenced events.

276A35487AF842E4B6F588DD3F6505AF.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

9B755C2962F74B7D8BB402DC66D9AA7A.description: Provide a closing or concluding statement.

E2406520EFB141479CD6B4D957F92EDC.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary when writing
claims related to a topic of study or text.Â

96F0E5FEDA6F41F9A0CBC8E0D974B87C.description:
Use complete, simple sentences, as well as
compound and other complex sentences as
appropriate.Â

A10CE17D014C422F9476042735EC801B.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, details, or
quotes.

AA16CBA131FB41D1A610CE9739B3E19A.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write an informative or
explanatory text that conveys ideas, concepts, and
information including visual, tactual, or multimedia
information as appropriate.Â

744FD144A16740739D5FD487EBF71EA7.description:
Write to share information supported by
details.

631F0E33ED1F4C059B26DD15EBC59364.description:
Support claims with reasons and evidence drawn
from text.

171B46861C464BD189DD886CA1CC625F.description:
Write an argument to support a claim that results
from studying a topic or reading a text.Â

F984F511B99E47548F33E911A0EDEF3D.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in reading or listening to literary non-fiction.

9AEE2A35FA64476A882C9D86BD0165DA.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3EA53E4C447A4CF4AD2A5799E9DFCB6F.description:
Compare and contrast arguments made by
two different texts on the same topic.

F10FC87B9CD84E53B422C648FCEFB7CB.description:
Determine whether the claims and
reasoning enhance the authorâs argument in an
informational text.

C6705A92C45C40BCA0D04D3A28DC9C5E.description:
Analyze information presented in different
media on related topics to answer questions or solve
problems.

86EDBECA27B84AE587C6E13F9C0A332B.description:
Determine authorâs point of view and
compare and contrast it with own point of view.

1DD576DA17F74471AA1C6B7881712020.description:
Determine whether the structure of a text
enhances an authorâs claim.

A1D15262911540D6B55186410CD6CAF4.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text,
including words with multiple meanings and figurative
language, impacts the meaning of the text.

02D4FFDE5721427394E5A220F4E2C6C6.description:
Determine how individuals, ideas, or events
change over the course of the text.

64FB79A072E642D79EC396346CB5052D.description:
Determine the central idea of a text; recount
the text.

C17B5995B86C46E185674C62441B08CD.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning and
cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit
understanding.

BF060A2EFE9F408D9966FD1FF2A85516.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas, and
poems.Â

F217FEE6785E48AAB63C6A7BB1CEDF7B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F1D6CD0288224C8693654E09A08C212A.description:
Demonstrate explicit understanding of
recounted versions of foundational works of American
literature.

81E4367DA86E4A48A1537BFB6D78C941.description:
Compare two or more interpretations (e.g.,
recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or
poetry) of a story, drama, or poem.Â

6C60E5A223DF4D55A33B5E0318DB0313.description:
Determine the point of view when there is a
difference between the authorâs actual language and
intended meaning.

E17A959F33E541089C350F035B876925.description:
Determine how the authorâs choice of
where to end the story contributes to the meaning.

030D353064974FB697868DA019BC206E.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text,
including words with multiple meanings and figurative
language, impact the meaning.

4EB699DD946C4C039E137F81D0C3B724.description:
Determine how characters, the setting or
events change over the course of the story or drama.

2C9561B44F844AFFA2A2EA82A7EC5A40.description:
Recount the main events of the text which
are related to the theme or central idea.

7350FBF5876D4BF287E6B78A059F59AA.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning and
cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit
understandings.
